name: unamenable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you are unamenable to something, you are not willing to accept it or be influenced by it: These children are totally unamenable to discipline. Few people are unamenable to his considerable charm.
If something is unamenable to study, measurement, etc., it cannot be studied, measured, etc.: The disease turned out to be unpredictable and unamenable to scientific study. Opposite
amenable
More examplesFewer examplesThey are convinced that they are right and are completely unamenable to argument or persuasion.The minimum amount of money you need to have saved in order to retire is unamenable to precise measurement.
